VariableDescription.Name: RPAflag
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         CNOFS
#     SOURCE_NAME                     CNOFS>Communications Navigation Outage Forecast System
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Ionospheric Science
#     DATA_TYPE                       K0>Key Parameter, the data are PRELIMINARY, and as such, are intended for BROWSE                       
#                                      PURPOSES ONLY.                                                                                        
#     DESCRIPTOR                      CINDI
#     FILE_NAMING_CONVENTION          source_datatype_descriptor
#     PI_NAME                         Dr. Roderick A. Heelis
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  University of Texas, Dallas
#     TEXT                            The Communications/Navigation Outage Forecasting System (C/NOFS) is a prototype                        
#     TEXT                             operational system designed to monitor and forecast ionospheric scintillation                         
#     TEXT                             in real-time and on a global scale. In the space-borne segment, C/NOFS will                           
#     TEXT                             fly a system of proven sensors on-board a three-axis stabilized satellite to                          
#     TEXT                             detect ionospheric scintillation. This will provide data for global, real-time                        
#                                      specification, and 4 hour forecast capability.                                                        
#                                     C/NOFS is a joint effort between the DOD Space Test Program and AFRL (Air Force                        
#                                      Research Laboratory). The space test program provides the spacecraft, launch                          
#                                      vehicle, launch and first year on-orbit operations.  AFRL is responsible for                          
#                                      the multi-instrument payload, payload integration  and test, model development,                       
#                                      data center operations, and product generation and distribution.                                      
#                                     The C/NOFS payload consists of six instruments: the Planar Langmuir Probe (PLP)                        
#                                      for measurements of plasma density, the Vector Electric Field Instrument (VEFI)                       
#                                      for measurements of vector electric and magnetic fields, the Ion Velocity Meter                       
#                                      (IVM) for measurements of plasma drift velocities and ion temperatures, the                           
#                                      Neutral Wind Meter (NWM) for measurements of neutral winds, the C/NOFS Occultation                    
#                                      Receiver for Ionospheric Sensing and Specification (CORISS) for remote sensing                        
#                                      of the electron density vertical profile, the Coherent Electromagnetic Radio                          
#                                      Tomography (CERTO) for measurements of ionospheric scintillation parameters.                          
#                                      Both the Neutral Wind Meter (NWM) and the Ion Velocity Meter (IVM) are provided                       
#                                      by NASA as the CINDI (Coupled Ion-Neutral Dynamics Investigation) payload,                            
#                                      which was selected as an Explorer Mission of Opportunity.                                             
#                                     The goal of C/NOFS is to forecast scintillation three to six hours before its                          
#                                      onset such that system operators will be able to plan in ways that will optimize                      
#                                      mission command and control.                                                                          
#                                     The spacecraft will be launched into an orbit with perigee/apogee of 400/700                           
#                                      km, and an inclination of 13 degrees. Launch is currently planned for early                           
#                                      2006.                                                                                                 
#                                     Information about C/NOFS can be found at Air Force Research Laboratory page:                           
#                                      http://www.kirtland.af.mil/shared/media/document/AFD-070404-094.pdf.                                  
#                                     The Coupled Ion-Neutral Dynamics Investigation (CINDI) payload is funded by                            
#                                      NASA as an Explorer Mission of Opportunity. CINDI consists of two instruments:                        
#                                      the Ion Velocity Meter (IVM) and the Neutral Wind Meter (NWM). The IVM instrument                     
#                                      includes a ion drift meter and a retarding potential analyzer. IVM measure                            
#                                      the ion drift vector, the ion temperature, and the major ion composition with                         
#                                      a spatial resolution of about 4 km along the satellite track; the ion drift                           
#                                      meter also provides vertical and horizontal ion drift components at 500 m resolution.                 
#                                      The NWM consists of a cross track wind sensor and a ram wind sensor providing                         
#                                      a direct measure of the neutral wind vector with a spatial resolution of about                        
#                                      8 km along the satellite track.                                                                       
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Particles (space)
#     MISSION_GROUP                   CNOFS
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  cnofs_cindi_ivm_500ms
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      CNOFS CINDI IVM ion density, composition, temperature, and drift (0.5-sec)
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 0.5 second
#     LINK_TEXT                       Please see
#                                     Information can be also found at
#     LINK_TITLE                      Cindi Project home page
#                                     NASA's CINDI page
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://cindispace.utdallas.edu/
#                                     http://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/cindi/
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Default time
#  2. RPA data quality flag: 0=high 9=low (http://spdf.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/data/cnofs/cindi/QualityFlagDesc.doc)
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 19:20:11 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. RPA data quality flag: 0=high 9=low (http://spdf.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/data/cnofs/cindi/QualityFlagDesc.doc)
#
EPOCH                   RPA-QUALITY
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms   0high-9low
01-08-2008 00:24:05.984           3

#     TEXT                             fly a system of proven sensors on-board a three-axis stabilized satellite to                          
#     TEXT                             detect ionospheric scintillation. This will provide data for global, real-time                        
#                                      specification, and 4 hour forecast capability.                                                        
#                                     C/NOFS is a joint effort between the DOD Space Test Program and AFRL (Air Force                        
#                                      Research Laboratory). The space test program provides the spacecraft, launch                          
#                                      vehicle, launch and first year on-orbit operations.  AFRL is responsible for                          
#                                      the multi-instrument payload, payload integration  and test, model development,                       
#                                      data center operations, and product generation and distribution.

#                                      for measurements of plasma density, the Vector Electric Field Instrument (VEFI)                       
#                                      for measurements of vector electric and magnetic fields, the Ion Velocity Meter                       
#                                      (IVM) for measurements of plasma drift velocities and ion temperatures, the                           
#                                      Neutral Wind Meter (NWM) for measurements of neutral winds, the C/NOFS Occultation                    
#                                      Receiver for Ionospheric Sensing and Specification (CORISS) for remote sensing                        
#                                      of the electron density vertical profile, the Coherent Electromagnetic Radio                          
#                                      Tomography (CERTO) for measurements of ionospheric scintillation parameters.                          
#                                      Both the Neutral Wind Meter (NWM) and the Ion Velocity Meter (IVM) are provided                       
#                                      by NASA as the CINDI (Coupled Ion-Neutral Dynamics Investigation) payload,                            
#                                      which was selected as an Explorer Mission of Opportunity.                                             
#                                     The goal of C/NOFS is to forecast scintillation three to six hours before its                          
#                                      onset such that system operators will be able to plan in ways that will optimize                      
#                                      mission command and control.

#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         CNOFS
#     SOURCE_NAME                     CNOFS>Communications Navigation Outage Forecast System
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Ionospheric Science
#     DATA_TYPE                       K0>Key Parameter, the data are PRELIMINARY, and as such, are intended for BROWSE                       
#                                      PURPOSES ONLY.                                                                                        
#     DESCRIPTOR                      CINDI
#     FILE_NAMING_CONVENTION          source_datatype_descriptor
#     PI_NAME                         Dr. Roderick A. Heelis
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  University of Texas, Dallas
#     TEXT                            The Communications/Navigation Outage Forecasting System (C/NOFS) is a prototype                        
#     TEXT                             operational system designed to monitor and forecast ionospheric scintillation                         
#     TEXT                             in real-time and on a global scale. In the space-borne segment, C/NOFS will                           
#     TEXT                             fly a system of proven sensors on-board a three-axis stabilized satellite to                          
#     TEXT                             detect ionospheric scintillation. This will provide data for global, real-time                        
#                                      specification, and 4 hour forecast capability.                                                        
#                                     C/NOFS is a joint effort between the DOD Space Test Program and AFRL (Air Force                        
#                                      Research Laboratory). The space test program provides the spacecraft, launch                          
#                                      vehicle, launch and first year on-orbit operations.  AFRL is responsible for                          
#                                      the multi-instrument payload, payload integration  and test, model development,                       
#                                      data center operations, and product generation and distribution.                                      
#                                     The C/NOFS payload consists of six instruments: the Planar Langmuir Probe (PLP)                        
#                                      for measurements of plasma density, the Vector Electric Field Instrument (VEFI)                       
#                                      for measurements of vector electric and magnetic fields, the Ion Velocity Meter                       
#                                      (IVM) for measurements of plasma drift velocities and ion temperatures, the                           
#                                      Neutral Wind Meter (NWM) for measurements of neutral winds, the C/NOFS Occultation                    
#                                      Receiver for Ionospheric Sensing and Specification (CORISS) for remote sensing                        
#                                      of the electron density vertical profile, the Coherent Electromagnetic Radio                          
#                                      Tomography (CERTO) for measurements of ionospheric scintillation parameters.                          
#                                      Both the Neutral Wind Meter (NWM) and the Ion Velocity Meter (IVM) are provided                       
#                                      by NASA as the CINDI (Coupled Ion-Neutral Dynamics Investigation) payload,                            
#                                      which was selected as an Explorer Mission of Opportunity.                                             
#                                     The goal of C/NOFS is to forecast scintillation three to six hours before its                          
#                                      onset such that system operators will be able to plan in ways that will optimize                      
#                                      mission command and control.                                                                          
#                                     The spacecraft will be launched into an orbit with perigee/apogee of 400/700                           
#                                      km, and an inclination of 13 degrees. Launch is currently planned for early                           
#                                      2006.                                                                                                 
#                                     Information about C/NOFS can be found at Air Force Research Laboratory page:                           
#                                      http://www.kirtland.af.mil/shared/media/document/AFD-070404-094.pdf.                                  
#                                     The Coupled Ion-Neutral Dynamics Investigation (CINDI) payload is funded by                            
#                                      NASA as an Explorer Mission of Opportunity. CINDI consists of two instruments:                        
#                                      the Ion Velocity Meter (IVM) and the Neutral Wind Meter (NWM). The IVM instrument                     
#                                      includes a ion drift meter and a retarding potential analyzer. IVM measure                            
#                                      the ion drift vector, the ion temperature, and the major ion composition with                         
#                                      a spatial resolution of about 4 km along the satellite track; the ion drift                           
#                                      meter also provides vertical and horizontal ion drift components at 500 m resolution.                 
#                                      The NWM consists of a cross track wind sensor and a ram wind sensor providing                         
#                                      a direct measure of the neutral wind vector with a spatial resolution of about                        
#                                      8 km along the satellite track.                                                                       
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Particles (space)
#     MISSION_GROUP                   CNOFS
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  cnofs_cindi_ivm_500ms
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      CNOFS CINDI IVM ion density, composition, temperature, and drift (0.5-sec)
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 0.5 second
#     LINK_TEXT                       Please see
#                                     Information can be also found at
#     LINK_TITLE                      Cindi Project home page
#                                     NASA's CINDI page
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://cindispace.utdallas.edu/
#                                     http://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/cindi/
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Default time
#  2. -------> Vi_zonal
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 19:20:23 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. -------> Vi_zonal
#
EPOCH                    VI_ZONAL_MAG
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms            m/s
01-08-2008 00:24:05.984      -999999.

#                                     Information about C/NOFS can be found at Air Force Research Laboratory page:

#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      CNOFS CINDI IVM ion density, composition, temperature, and drift (0.5-sec)
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 0.5 second
#     LINK_TEXT                       Please see
#                                     Information can be also found at
#     LINK_TITLE                      Cindi Project home page
#                                     NASA's CINDI page
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://cindispace.utdallas.edu/
#                                     http://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/cindi/
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Default time
#  2. -------> Vi_meridional
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.

VariableDescription.Name: ion1fraction
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         CNOFS
#     SOURCE_NAME                     CNOFS>Communications Navigation Outage Forecast System
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Ionospheric Science
#     DATA_TYPE                       K0>Key Parameter, the data are PRELIMINARY, and as such, are intended for BROWSE                       
#                                      PURPOSES ONLY.                                                                                        
#     DESCRIPTOR                      CINDI
#     FILE_NAMING_CONVENTION          source_datatype_descriptor
#     PI_NAME                         Dr. Roderick A. Heelis
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  University of Texas, Dallas
#     TEXT                            The Communications/Navigation Outage Forecasting System (C/NOFS) is a prototype                        
#     TEXT                             operational system designed to monitor and forecast ionospheric scintillation                         
#     TEXT                             in real-time and on a global scale. In the space-borne segment, C/NOFS will                           
#     TEXT                             fly a system of proven sensors on-board a three-axis stabilized satellite to                          
#     TEXT                             detect ionospheric scintillation. This will provide data for global, real-time                        
#                                      specification, and 4 hour forecast capability.                                                        
#                                     C/NOFS is a joint effort between the DOD Space Test Program and AFRL (Air Force                        
#                                      Research Laboratory). The space test program provides the spacecraft, launch                          
#                                      vehicle, launch and first year on-orbit operations.  AFRL is responsible for                          
#                                      the multi-instrument payload, payload integration  and test, model development,                       
#                                      data center operations, and product generation and distribution.                                      
#                                     The C/NOFS payload consists of six instruments: the Planar Langmuir Probe (PLP)                        
#                                      for measurements of plasma density, the Vector Electric Field Instrument (VEFI)                       
#                                      for measurements of vector electric and magnetic fields, the Ion Velocity Meter                       
#                                      (IVM) for measurements of plasma drift velocities and ion temperatures, the                           
#                                      Neutral Wind Meter (NWM) for measurements of neutral winds, the C/NOFS Occultation                    
#                                      Receiver for Ionospheric Sensing and Specification (CORISS) for remote sensing                        
#                                      of the electron density vertical profile, the Coherent Electromagnetic Radio                          
#                                      Tomography (CERTO) for measurements of ionospheric scintillation parameters.                          
#                                      Both the Neutral Wind Meter (NWM) and the Ion Velocity Meter (IVM) are provided                       
#                                      by NASA as the CINDI (Coupled Ion-Neutral Dynamics Investigation) payload,                            
#                                      which was selected as an Explorer Mission of Opportunity.                                             
#                                     The goal of C/NOFS is to forecast scintillation three to six hours before its                          
#                                      onset such that system operators will be able to plan in ways that will optimize                      
#                                      mission command and control.                                                                          
#                                     The spacecraft will be launched into an orbit with perigee/apogee of 400/700                           
#                                      km, and an inclination of 13 degrees. Launch is currently planned for early                           
#                                      2006.                                                                                                 
#                                     Information about C/NOFS can be found at Air Force Research Laboratory page:                           
#                                      http://www.kirtland.af.mil/shared/media/document/AFD-070404-094.pdf.                                  
#                                     The Coupled Ion-Neutral Dynamics Investigation (CINDI) payload is funded by                            
#                                      NASA as an Explorer Mission of Opportunity. CINDI consists of two instruments:                        
#                                      the Ion Velocity Meter (IVM) and the Neutral Wind Meter (NWM). The IVM instrument                     
#                                      includes a ion drift meter and a retarding potential analyzer. IVM measure                            
#                                      the ion drift vector, the ion temperature, and the major ion composition with                         
#                                      a spatial resolution of about 4 km along the satellite track; the ion drift                           
#                                      meter also provides vertical and horizontal ion drift components at 500 m resolution.                 
#                                      The NWM consists of a cross track wind sensor and a ram wind sensor providing                         
#                                      a direct measure of the neutral wind vector with a spatial resolution of about                        
#                                      8 km along the satellite track.                                                                       
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Particles (space)
#     MISSION_GROUP                   CNOFS
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  cnofs_cindi_ivm_500ms
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      CNOFS CINDI IVM ion density, composition, temperature, and drift (0.5-sec)
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 0.5 second
#     LINK_TEXT                       Please see
#                                     Information can be also found at
#     LINK_TITLE                      Cindi Project home page
#                                     NASA's CINDI page
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://cindispace.utdallas.edu/
#                                     http://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/cindi/
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Default time
#  2. --------> fraction of ion1
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 19:20:29 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. --------> fraction of ion1
#
EPOCH                            ION1
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms       fraction
01-08-2008 00:24:05.984     0.0852717

VariableDescription.Name: atomicMass_ion5
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         CNOFS
#     SOURCE_NAME                     CNOFS>Communications Navigation Outage Forecast System
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Ionospheric Science
#     DATA_TYPE                       K0>Key Parameter, the data are PRELIMINARY, and as such, are intended for BROWSE                       
#                                      PURPOSES ONLY.                                                                                        
#     DESCRIPTOR                      CINDI
#     FILE_NAMING_CONVENTION          source_datatype_descriptor
#     PI_NAME                         Dr. Roderick A. Heelis
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  University of Texas, Dallas
#     TEXT                            The Communications/Navigation Outage Forecasting System (C/NOFS) is a prototype                        
#     TEXT                             operational system designed to monitor and forecast ionospheric scintillation                         
#     TEXT                             in real-time and on a global scale. In the space-borne segment, C/NOFS will                           
#     TEXT                             fly a system of proven sensors on-board a three-axis stabilized satellite to                          
#     TEXT                             detect ionospheric scintillation. This will provide data for global, real-time                        
#                                      specification, and 4 hour forecast capability.                                                        
#                                     C/NOFS is a joint effort between the DOD Space Test Program and AFRL (Air Force                        
#                                      Research Laboratory). The space test program provides the spacecraft, launch                          
#                                      vehicle, launch and first year on-orbit operations.  AFRL is responsible for                          
#                                      the multi-instrument payload, payload integration  and test, model development,                       
#                                      data center operations, and product generation and distribution.                                      
#                                     The C/NOFS payload consists of six instruments: the Planar Langmuir Probe (PLP)                        
#                                      for measurements of plasma density, the Vector Electric Field Instrument (VEFI)                       
#                                      for measurements of vector electric and magnetic fields, the Ion Velocity Meter                       
#                                      (IVM) for measurements of plasma drift velocities and ion temperatures, the                           
#                                      Neutral Wind Meter (NWM) for measurements of neutral winds, the C/NOFS Occultation                    
#                                      Receiver for Ionospheric Sensing and Specification (CORISS) for remote sensing                        
#                                      of the electron density vertical profile, the Coherent Electromagnetic Radio                          
#                                      Tomography (CERTO) for measurements of ionospheric scintillation parameters.                          
#                                      Both the Neutral Wind Meter (NWM) and the Ion Velocity Meter (IVM) are provided                       
#                                      by NASA as the CINDI (Coupled Ion-Neutral Dynamics Investigation) payload,                            
#                                      which was selected as an Explorer Mission of Opportunity.                                             
#                                     The goal of C/NOFS is to forecast scintillation three to six hours before its                          
#                                      onset such that system operators will be able to plan in ways that will optimize                      
#                                      mission command and control.                                                                          
#                                     The spacecraft will be launched into an orbit with perigee/apogee of 400/700                           
#                                      km, and an inclination of 13 degrees. Launch is currently planned for early                           
#                                      2006.                                                                                                 
#                                     Information about C/NOFS can be found at Air Force Research Laboratory page:                           
#                                      http://www.kirtland.af.mil/shared/media/document/AFD-070404-094.pdf.                                  
#                                     The Coupled Ion-Neutral Dynamics Investigation (CINDI) payload is funded by                            
#                                      NASA as an Explorer Mission of Opportunity. CINDI consists of two instruments:                        
#                                      the Ion Velocity Meter (IVM) and the Neutral Wind Meter (NWM). The IVM instrument                     
#                                      includes a ion drift meter and a retarding potential analyzer. IVM measure                            
#                                      the ion drift vector, the ion temperature, and the major ion composition with                         
#                                      a spatial resolution of about 4 km along the satellite track; the ion drift                           
#                                      meter also provides vertical and horizontal ion drift components at 500 m resolution.                 
#                                      The NWM consists of a cross track wind sensor and a ram wind sensor providing                         
#                                      a direct measure of the neutral wind vector with a spatial resolution of about                        
#                                      8 km along the satellite track.                                                                       
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Particles (space)
#     MISSION_GROUP                   CNOFS
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  cnofs_cindi_ivm_500ms
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      CNOFS CINDI IVM ion density, composition, temperature, and drift (0.5-sec)
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 0.5 second
#     LINK_TEXT                       Please see
#                                     Information can be also found at
#     LINK_TITLE                      Cindi Project home page
#                                     NASA's CINDI page
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://cindispace.utdallas.edu/
#                                     http://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/cindi/
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Default time
#  2. Ion 5 -------> Atomic Mass Number
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 19:20:35 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Ion 5 -------> Atomic Mass Number
#
EPOCH                   ION5
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms   AMU
01-08-2008 00:24:05.984   99

#     TEXT                             in real-time and on a global scale. In the space-borne segment, C/NOFS will                           
#     TEXT                             fly a system of proven sensors on-board a three-axis stabilized satellite to                          
#     TEXT                             detect ionospheric scintillation. This will provide data for global, real-time                        
#                                      specification, and 4 hour forecast capability.                                                        
#                                     C/NOFS is a joint effort between the DOD Space Test Program and AFRL (Air Force                        
#                                      Research Laboratory). The space test program provides the spacecraft, launch                          
#                                      vehicle, launch and first year on-orbit operations.  AFRL is responsible for                          
#                                      the multi-instrument payload, payload integration  and test, model development,                       
#                                      data center operations, and product generation and distribution.

#                                      for measurements of plasma density, the Vector Electric Field Instrument (VEFI)                       
#                                      for measurements of vector electric and magnetic fields, the Ion Velocity Meter                       
#                                      (IVM) for measurements of plasma drift velocities and ion temperatures, the

#                                      Receiver for Ionospheric Sensing and Specification (CORISS) for remote sensing                        
#                                      of the electron density vertical profile, the Coherent Electromagnetic Radio                          
#                                      Tomography (CERTO) for measurements of ionospheric scintillation parameters.

#     PI_NAME                         Dr. Roderick A. Heelis
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  University of Texas, Dallas
#     TEXT                            The Communications/Navigation Outage Forecasting System (C/NOFS) is a prototype                        
#     TEXT                             operational system designed to monitor and forecast ionospheric scintillation                         
#     TEXT                             in real-time and on a global scale. In the space-borne segment, C/NOFS will                           
#     TEXT                             fly a system of proven sensors on-board a three-axis stabilized satellite to                          
#     TEXT                             detect ionospheric scintillation. This will provide data for global, real-time                        
#                                      specification, and 4 hour forecast capability.                                                        
#                                     C/NOFS is a joint effort between the DOD Space Test Program and AFRL (Air Force                        
#                                      Research Laboratory). The space test program provides the spacecraft, launch                          
#                                      vehicle, launch and first year on-orbit operations.  AFRL is responsible for                          
#                                      the multi-instrument payload, payload integration  and test, model development,                       
#                                      data center operations, and product generation and distribution.                                      
#                                     The C/NOFS payload consists of six instruments: the Planar Langmuir Probe (PLP)                        
#                                      for measurements of plasma density, the Vector Electric Field Instrument (VEFI)                       
#                                      for measurements of vector electric and magnetic fields, the Ion Velocity Meter                       
#                                      (IVM) for measurements of plasma drift velocities and ion temperatures, the                           
#                                      Neutral Wind Meter (NWM) for measurements of neutral winds, the C/NOFS Occultation                    
#                                      Receiver for Ionospheric Sensing and Specification (CORISS) for remote sensing                        
#                                      of the electron density vertical profile, the Coherent Electromagnetic Radio                          
#                                      Tomography (CERTO) for measurements of ionospheric scintillation parameters.                          
#                                      Both the Neutral Wind Meter (NWM) and the Ion Velocity Meter (IVM) are provided                       
#                                      by NASA as the CINDI (Coupled Ion-Neutral Dynamics Investigation) payload,                            
#                                      which was selected as an Explorer Mission of Opportunity.                                             
#                                     The goal of C/NOFS is to forecast scintillation three to six hours before its                          
#                                      onset such that system operators will be able to plan in ways that will optimize                      
#                                      mission command and control.                                                                          
#                                     The spacecraft will be launched into an orbit with perigee/apogee of 400/700                           
#                                      km, and an inclination of 13 degrees. Launch is currently planned for early                           
#                                      2006.                                                                                                 
#                                     Information about C/NOFS can be found at Air Force Research Laboratory page:                           
#                                      http://www.kirtland.af.mil/shared/media/document/AFD-070404-094.pdf.                                  
#                                     The Coupled Ion-Neutral Dynamics Investigation (CINDI) payload is funded by                            
#                                      NASA as an Explorer Mission of Opportunity. CINDI consists of two instruments:                        
#                                      the Ion Velocity Meter (IVM) and the Neutral Wind Meter (NWM). The IVM instrument                     
#                                      includes a ion drift meter and a retarding potential analyzer. IVM measure                            
#                                      the ion drift vector, the ion temperature, and the major ion composition with                         
#                                      a spatial resolution of about 4 km along the satellite track; the ion drift                           
#                                      meter also provides vertical and horizontal ion drift components at 500 m resolution.                 
#                                      The NWM consists of a cross track wind sensor and a ram wind sensor providing                         
#                                      a direct measure of the neutral wind vector with a spatial resolution of about                        
#                                      8 km along the satellite track.                                                                       
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Particles (space)
#     MISSION_GROUP                   CNOFS
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  cnofs_cindi_ivm_500ms
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      CNOFS CINDI IVM ion density, composition, temperature, and drift (0.5-sec)
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 0.5 second

#                                      Tomography (CERTO) for measurements of ionospheric scintillation parameters.

#     TEXT                             in real-time and on a global scale. In the space-borne segment, C/NOFS will                           
#     TEXT                             fly a system of proven sensors on-board a three-axis stabilized satellite to                          
#     TEXT                             detect ionospheric scintillation. This will provide data for global, real-time                        
#                                      specification, and 4 hour forecast capability.                                                        
#                                     C/NOFS is a joint effort between the DOD Space Test Program and AFRL (Air Force

#                                      the multi-instrument payload, payload integration  and test, model development,

#                                      for measurements of plasma density, the Vector Electric Field Instrument (VEFI)

#                                      Receiver for Ionospheric Sensing and Specification (CORISS) for remote sensing

#                                      Tomography (CERTO) for measurements of ionospheric scintillation parameters.

#     TEXT                             operational system designed to monitor and forecast ionospheric scintillation                         
#     TEXT                             in real-time and on a global scale. In the space-borne segment, C/NOFS will                           
#     TEXT                             fly a system of proven sensors on-board a three-axis stabilized satellite to                          
#     TEXT                             detect ionospheric scintillation. This will provide data for global, real-time                        
#                                      specification, and 4 hour forecast capability.                                                        
#                                     C/NOFS is a joint effort between the DOD Space Test Program and AFRL (Air Force                        
#                                      Research Laboratory). The space test program provides the spacecraft, launch                          
#                                      vehicle, launch and first year on-orbit operations.  AFRL is responsible for                          
#                                      the multi-instrument payload, payload integration  and test, model development,                       
#                                      data center operations, and product generation and distribution.                                      
#                                     The C/NOFS payload consists of six instruments: the Planar Langmuir Probe (PLP)                        
#                                      for measurements of plasma density, the Vector Electric Field Instrument (VEFI)                       
#                                      for measurements of vector electric and magnetic fields, the Ion Velocity Meter                       
#                                      (IVM) for measurements of plasma drift velocities and ion temperatures, the                           
#                                      Neutral Wind Meter (NWM) for measurements of neutral winds, the C/NOFS Occultation                    
#                                      Receiver for Ionospheric Sensing and Specification (CORISS) for remote sensing                        
#                                      of the electron density vertical profile, the Coherent Electromagnetic Radio                          
#                                      Tomography (CERTO) for measurements of ionospheric scintillation parameters.

VariableDescription.Name: parallelunitvectorY
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         CNOFS
#     SOURCE_NAME                     CNOFS>Communications Navigation Outage Forecast System
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Ionospheric Science
#     DATA_TYPE                       K0>Key Parameter, the data are PRELIMINARY, and as such, are intended for BROWSE                       
#                                      PURPOSES ONLY.                                                                                        
#     DESCRIPTOR                      CINDI
#     FILE_NAMING_CONVENTION          source_datatype_descriptor
#     PI_NAME                         Dr. Roderick A. Heelis
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  University of Texas, Dallas
#     TEXT                            The Communications/Navigation Outage Forecasting System (C/NOFS) is a prototype                        
#     TEXT                             operational system designed to monitor and forecast ionospheric scintillation                         
#     TEXT                             in real-time and on a global scale. In the space-borne segment, C/NOFS will                           
#     TEXT                             fly a system of proven sensors on-board a three-axis stabilized satellite to                          
#     TEXT                             detect ionospheric scintillation. This will provide data for global, real-time                        
#                                      specification, and 4 hour forecast capability.                                                        
#                                     C/NOFS is a joint effort between the DOD Space Test Program and AFRL (Air Force                        
#                                      Research Laboratory). The space test program provides the spacecraft, launch                          
#                                      vehicle, launch and first year on-orbit operations.  AFRL is responsible for                          
#                                      the multi-instrument payload, payload integration  and test, model development,                       
#                                      data center operations, and product generation and distribution.                                      
#                                     The C/NOFS payload consists of six instruments: the Planar Langmuir Probe (PLP)                        
#                                      for measurements of plasma density, the Vector Electric Field Instrument (VEFI)                       
#                                      for measurements of vector electric and magnetic fields, the Ion Velocity Meter                       
#                                      (IVM) for measurements of plasma drift velocities and ion temperatures, the                           
#                                      Neutral Wind Meter (NWM) for measurements of neutral winds, the C/NOFS Occultation                    
#                                      Receiver for Ionospheric Sensing and Specification (CORISS) for remote sensing                        
#                                      of the electron density vertical profile, the Coherent Electromagnetic Radio                          
#                                      Tomography (CERTO) for measurements of ionospheric scintillation parameters.                          
#                                      Both the Neutral Wind Meter (NWM) and the Ion Velocity Meter (IVM) are provided                       
#                                      by NASA as the CINDI (Coupled Ion-Neutral Dynamics Investigation) payload,                            
#                                      which was selected as an Explorer Mission of Opportunity.                                             
#                                     The goal of C/NOFS is to forecast scintillation three to six hours before its                          
#                                      onset such that system operators will be able to plan in ways that will optimize                      
#                                      mission command and control.                                                                          
#                                     The spacecraft will be launched into an orbit with perigee/apogee of 400/700                           
#                                      km, and an inclination of 13 degrees. Launch is currently planned for early                           
#                                      2006.                                                                                                 
#                                     Information about C/NOFS can be found at Air Force Research Laboratory page:                           
#                                      http://www.kirtland.af.mil/shared/media/document/AFD-070404-094.pdf.                                  
#                                     The Coupled Ion-Neutral Dynamics Investigation (CINDI) payload is funded by                            
#                                      NASA as an Explorer Mission of Opportunity. CINDI consists of two instruments:                        
#                                      the Ion Velocity Meter (IVM) and the Neutral Wind Meter (NWM). The IVM instrument                     
#                                      includes a ion drift meter and a retarding potential analyzer. IVM measure                            
#                                      the ion drift vector, the ion temperature, and the major ion composition with                         
#                                      a spatial resolution of about 4 km along the satellite track; the ion drift                           
#                                      meter also provides vertical and horizontal ion drift components at 500 m resolution.                 
#                                      The NWM consists of a cross track wind sensor and a ram wind sensor providing                         
#                                      a direct measure of the neutral wind vector with a spatial resolution of about                        
#                                      8 km along the satellite track.                                                                       
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Particles (space)
#     MISSION_GROUP                   CNOFS
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  cnofs_cindi_ivm_500ms
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      CNOFS CINDI IVM ion density, composition, temperature, and drift (0.5-sec)
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 0.5 second
#     LINK_TEXT                       Please see
#                                     Information can be also found at
#     LINK_TITLE                      Cindi Project home page
#                                     NASA's CINDI page
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://cindispace.utdallas.edu/
#                                     http://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/cindi/
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Default time
#  2. -------> U_parallel_SC_y
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 19:21:02 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. -------> U_parallel_SC_y
#
EPOCH                     U_PARA_SC_Y
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms               
01-08-2008 00:24:05.984      -999999.
